p: Dengue has a wide spectrum of clinical presentations, often with unpredictable clinical evolution and outcomes. The infection causes flu-like illness (dengue without warning signsâ€”DWWS) and occasionally develops into a potentially lethal complication called severe dengue (SD) [ 1, 4]. Thrombocytopenia is commonly reported because immunological peripheral destruction of platelets and decreased platelet production due to bone marrow suppression and attenuation of megakaryocyte maturation occur in dengue fever; however, dengue thrombocytopenia is transient, and spontaneous platelet count recovery is always observed [ 5].
